sen.j: 中御門家（なかのみかどけ）は、藤原北家勧修寺流の公家。
sen.e: The Nakanomikado family was a court noble of Kjuji-ryu (the Kajuji lineage) of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
The Nakanomikado family was court nobility of Kjuji-ryu (the Kajuji lineage) of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: "noble" refers to a single person. For a family, "nobility"is better.
sen.e: The Nakanomikado family was court nobility of Kajuji-ryu (the Kajuji lineage) of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
A family of noble race, the marquess.
Noble family with the rank of marquess
sen.cmt: The meaning of trans 1 is unclear.
sen.e: Noble family with the rank of marquess

sen.j: 中御門家（なかみかどけ）は、藤原北家中御門流の公家。
sen.e: The Nakamikado family was a court noble of Nakamikado-ryu (the Nakamikado line) of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
The Nakamikado family was a court nobility Nakamikado-ryu (the Nakamikado line) of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: "noble" refers to a single person. For a family, "nobility"is better.
sen.e: The Nakamikado family was a court nobility Nakamikado-ryu (the Nakamikado line) of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 藤原道長の二男、右大臣藤原頼宗の後裔。
sen.e: The descendant of FUJIWARA no Yorimune, the udaijin (minister of the right), the second son of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
The family was descended from FUJIWARA no Yorimune, udaijin (minister of the right) and second son of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
The family was descended from FUJIWARA no Yorimune, udaijin (minister of the right) and second son of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.

sen.j: 別称の松木家を参照のこと。
sen.e: See the Matsunoki family, its another name.
See "Matsunoki family", the other name for the Nakamikado family.
See "Matsunoki family", the other name for the Nakamikado family.

sen.j: 中御門家（なかのみかどけ）は、名家 (公家)の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: The Nakanomikado family was a court noble with a family status of the family of noble race (court noble).
The Nakanomikado family belconged to the court nobility and had a family status noble (court noble).
The Nakanomikado family belonged to the court nobility and had a family status noble (court noble).

sen.j: 藤原北家勧修寺流、勧修寺家庶流。
sen.e: The Kajuji-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan, an illegitimate family lineage of the Kajuji family.
The Kajuji-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan, an illegitimate family lineage of the Kajuji family.
The Kajuji-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan, an illegitimate family lineage of the Kajuji family.
The family crest was a combination of a bamboo and a sparrow.
The family crest was a combination of bamboo and a sparrow.
The family crest was a combination of bamboo and a sparrow.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 260 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 260 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 260 koku.
Became 200 koku at the end of Edo period.
The stipend became 200 koku at the end of Edo period.
The stipend became 200 koku at the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 明治維新後、伯爵を経て侯爵。
sen.e: Became the earl and then the marquess after the Meiji Restoration.
Became the earl and then the marquess after the Meiji Restoration.
Became the earl and then the marquess after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代中期、勧修寺経俊（吉田経俊）の四男、中御門経継により創設される。
sen.e: The family was created by Tsunetsugu NAKAMIKADO, the fourth son of Tsunetoshi KAJUJI (Tsunetoshi YOSHIDA), in the mid-Kamakura period.
The family originated with Tsunetsugu NAKAMIKADO, the fourth son of Tsunetoshi KAJUJI (Tsunetoshi YOSHIDA), in the mid-Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: I think "originated with" is better than "created".
sen.e: The family originated with Tsunetsugu NAKAMIKADO, the fourth son of Tsunetoshi KAJUJI (Tsunetoshi YOSHIDA), in the mid-Kamakura period.

sen.j: 幕末、明治維新期の中御門経之は、国事に奔走し、議定、会計事務総督、留守長官などを歴任した。
sen.e: Tsuneyuki NAKAMIKADO at the end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration worked hard for affairs of state, and served as the agreement, the chief of accountancy, and the rusu chokan successively.

At the end of Edo period and the beginning of the Meiji Restoration, Tsuneyuki NAKAMIKADO worked hard for affairs of state, and served successively as gitei, the chief of accountancy, and the rusu chokan.
sen.cmt: "agreement" does not make sense here. If it is some kind of official post write "gitei" followed by and explanation. An explanation is also required for "rusu chokan".
sen.e: At the end of Edo period and the beginning of the Meiji Restoration, Tsuneyuki NAKAMIKADO worked hard for affairs of state, and served successively as gitei, the chief of accountancy, and the rusu chokan.

sen.j: 明治17年7月7日伯爵の位を賜り、更に明治21年1月17日侯爵に陞爵した。
sen.e: The earlship was given on July 7, 1884, and ranked up to the marquess on January 17, 1888.
The family were awards an earldom on July 7, 1884, and then awarded the title of marquess on January 17, 1888.
The family were awarded an earldom on July 7, 1884, and then awarded the title of marquess on January 17, 1888.

sen.j: 経之の子、経明には嗣子が無く、萬千子（まちこ）が中御門家を相続、婦人が戸主となったため、侯爵位を返上したが、分家から経恭（つねやす）を養子に迎えて、改めて旧に復した。
sen.e: Tsuneaki, the son of Tsuneyuki, had no hear, and Machiko inherited the Nakamikado family; the marquisate was returned as a woman became the householder, however, the family adopted Tsuneyasu from the branch family and returned to the previous state.

When Tsuneaki, the son of Tsuneyuki, had no heir, and Machiko, a woman, inherited the Nakamikado family name, the title of marquess was returned; but the family adopted Tsuneyasu from a branch family and were able to recover their status.

When Tsuneaki, the son of Tsuneyuki, had no heir, and Machiko, a woman, inherited the Nakamikado family name, the title of marquess was returned; but the family adopted Tsuneyasu from a branch family and were able to recover their status.

sen.j: また、経俊の弟である吉田為経の子・中御門経任も「中御門」の家名を名乗っている。
sen.e: Tsunetada NAKAMIKADO, the son of Tametsune YOSHIDA who was the younger brother of Tsunetoshi, also identified himself as the "Nakamikado" family.
Tsunetada NAKAMIKADO, the son of Tametsune YOSHIDA who was the younger brother of Tsunetoshi, also identified himself as the "Nakamikado" family.
Tsunetada NAKAMIKADO, the son of Tametsune YOSHIDA who was the younger brother of Tsunetoshi, also identified himself as the 'Nakamikado' family.

sen.j: 後嵯峨天皇の腹心であった経任在世中は、従兄弟である経継系よりも羽振りが良かったものの政敵も多く南北朝時代_(日本)初期頃に断絶している。
sen.e: While Tsunetada who was a confidant of Emperor Gosaga lived, the family was more prosperous than the Tsunetsugu lineage of his cousin; however, as the family had a lot of political opponents, it was extinguished around the beginning of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

While Tsunetada who was a confidant of Emperor Gosaga was alive, the family was more prosperous than the Tsunetsugu lineage of his cousin, but he also had a number of political opponents, and this led to the family being discontinued around the beginning of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

While Tsunetada who was a confidant of the Emperor Gosaga was alive, the family was more prosperous than the Tsunetsugu lineage of his cousin, but he also had a number of political opponents, and this led to the family being discontinued around the beginning of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
A list of family heads in chronological order
A list of family heads in chronological order

sen.cmt: 中御門資凞→Sukehiro NAKAMIKADO[読み方不明]
中御門宣顕→Nobuaki NAKAMIKADO[読み方不明]
中御門俊臣→Toshiomi NAKAMIKADO[読み方不明]
